alert.note: Alert for Los Alamos; Santa Fe (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 9:48PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Grande Near San Ildefonso Pueblo affecting Los Alamos and Santa Fe Counties. Rio Grande At Rio Grande at Embudo affecting Los Alamos, Rio Arriba and Santa Fe Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...High flows and minor overbank flooding is expected due to rain and snowmelt. * WHERE...Rio Grande near San Ildefonso Pueblo. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, flooding of cultivated lands upstream of the Otowi gage will increase if water levels rise further. Fast flowing water could undermine the river banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM MDT Friday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady below flood stage at 8.1 feet. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning around 1000 AM MDT.
